member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AddressSpace.AECategoryElement.AttributeElements
member.summary: Event attributes that the server can provide as part of an event notification within this event category.

remarks.para: Simple servers may not support any vendor-specific attributes for some or even all event categories.
This is a keyed collection where the key is attribute ID, and the value is an .

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AddressSpace.AECategoryElement.CategoryId
member.summary: Category ID.

remarks.para: Event categories are vendor-specific. Their category IDs can be used in the event subscription for specifying filters. Category IDs are unique across the server (e.g. if Category ID x is used for both simple events and condition events, then the ID references the exact same category.)

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AddressSpace.AECategoryElement.ConditionElements
member.summary: Event conditions supported by this event category.

remarks.para: This is a keyed collection where the key is condition name, and the value is an .

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AddressSpace.AEConditionElement.Name
member.summary: Condition name. This is the string to be used for display purposes.

remarks.para: Condition names are server specific.
The number of condition names returned will vary depending on the sophistication of the server, but is expected to be less than 30 for most servers.

The Server is in fact allowed to change the available selection at any time. Therefore, a Client should do (or at least allow as an option) a fresh Query every time a selection is to be presented to the end user.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AddressSpace.AEConditionElement.SubconditionNames
member.summary: An array of subcondition names.

remarks.para: Subcondition names are server specific.
The number of sub-condition names returned will vary depending on the sophistication of the server, but is expected to be less than 10 for most servers.

It is expected that the available subcondition names for a particular condition on the Server will be fairly 'stable' and that they will generally not change 'online'. However, the Server is in fact allowed to change the available selection at any time. Therefore, a Client should do (or at least allow as an option) a fresh Query every time a selection is to be presented to the end user.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.SubconditionElements
member.summary: Sub-conditions defined for this condition.

remarks.para: For multi-state conditions, there will be more than one subcondition. For single-state conditions, there will be one subcondition.
This is a keyed collection where the key is the subcondition name, and the value is an .

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.AttributeValues
member.summary: Attributes associated with latest event notification for this condition.

remarks.para: Attributes are vendor-specific.
If a server cannot provide reasonable data for an attribute, the returned VARIANT should is set to VT_EMPTY.
This is a dictionary where the key is attribute ID, and the value is the actual value of that event attribute.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.ActiveSubcondition
member.summary: Currently active sub-condition, for multi-state conditions which are active. For a single-state condition, this contains the information about the condition itself.

remarks.para: Contains an .
For inactive conditions, this value is null.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.Enabled
member.summary: The condition is enabled.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.Active
member.summary: The condition is active.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.Acknowledged
member.summary: The condition is acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.Quality
member.summary: Quality associated with the condition state.

remarks.para: Values are as defined for the OPC Quality Flags in the OPC Data Access Server specification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.ActiveTime
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into the condition. There may be transitions among the sub-conditions which are more recent. In UTC.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been active.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.ActiveTimeLocal
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into the condition. There may be transitions among the sub-conditions which are more recent. In local time.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been active.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.SubconditionActiveTime
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into active subcondition. This is the time value which must be specified when acknowledging the condition. In UTC.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been active.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.SubconditionActiveTimeLocal
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into active subcondition. This is the time value which must be specified when acknowledging the condition. In local time.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been active.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.InactiveTime
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition out of this condition. In UTC.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been active, or if it is currently active for the first time and has never been exited.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.InactiveTimeLocal
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition out of this condition. In local time

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been active, or if it is currently active for the first time and has never been exited.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.AcknowledgeTime
member.summary: The time of the most recent acknowledgment of this condition (of any sub-condition). In UTC.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.AcknowledgeTimeLocal
member.summary: The time of the most recent acknowledgment of this condition (of any sub-condition). In local time.

remarks.para: Contains 0 if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.AcknowledgerId
member.summary: This is the ID of the client who last acknowledged this condition.

remarks.para: Contains an empty string if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEConditionState.Comment
member.summary: The comment string passed in by the client who last acknowledged this condition.

remarks.para: Contains an empty string if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.QualifiedSourceName
member.summary: The source of event notification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Time
member.summary: Time of the event occurrence - for conditions, time that the condition transitioned into the new state or sub-condition. In UTC.

remarks.para: For example, if the event notification is for acknowledgment of a condition, this would be the time that the condition became acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.TimeLocal
member.summary: Time of the event occurrence - for conditions, time that the condition transitioned into the new state or sub-condition. In local time.

remarks.para: For example, if the event notification is for acknowledgment of a condition, this would be the time that the condition became acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Message
member.summary: Event notification message describing the event.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.EventType
member.summary: Simple, Condition-Related, or Tracking event.

remarks.para: One of constants.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.CategoryId
member.summary: Event category ID.

remarks.para: Standard and Vendor-specific event category codes.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Severity
member.summary: Event severity (1..1000).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.AttributeValues
member.summary: Vendor-specific event attributes.

remarks.para: Attributes are vendor-specific.
If a server cannot provide reasonable data for an attribute, the returned VARIANT should be set to VT_EMPTY.
This is a dictionary where the key is attribute ID, and the value is the actual value of that event attribute.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.ConditionName
member.summary: The name of the condition related to this event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.SubconditionName
member.summary: The name of the current sub-condition, for multi-state conditions. For a single-state condition, this contains the condition name.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Enabled
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is enabled.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Active
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is active.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Acknowledged
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is acknowledged.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Quality
member.summary: Quality associated with the condition.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: Values are as defined for the OPC Quality Flags in the OPC Data Access Server specification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.AcknowledgeRequired
member.summary: This flag indicates that the related condition requires acknowledgment of this event.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The determination of those events which require acknowledgment is server specific. For example, transition into a LimitAlarm condition would likely require an acknowledgment, while the event notification of the resulting acknowledgment would likely not require an acknowledgment.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.ActiveTime
member.summary: Time that the condition became active (for single-state conditions), or the time of the transition into the current sub-condition (for multi-state conditions). In UTC.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: This time is used by the client when acknowledging the condition.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.ActiveTimeLocal
member.summary: Time that the condition became active (for single-state conditions), or the time of the transition into the current sub-condition (for multi-state conditions). In local time.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: This time is used by the client when acknowledging the condition.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.Cookie
member.summary: Server defined cookie associated with the event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The cookie is used by the client when acknowledging the condition. This value is opaque to the client.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData.ActorId
member.summary: Actor ID.

para.b: This property is used only for Tracking Events and for Condition-Related Events which are acknowledgment notifications (see EventType).

remarks.para: For tracking events, this is the actor ID for the event notification.
For condition-related events, this is the AcknowledgerID when the new state is acknowledged. If the AcknowledgerID is an empty string, the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
For other events, the value is an empty string.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClient.BrowseAreas(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browses the specified area for child areas. Uses computer name and server class for specifying the OPC server. A parent area is passed in. No filtering.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
Fully qualified name of the parent area to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular area found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the areas.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClient.BrowseSources(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browses the specified area for child sources. Uses computer name and server class for specifying the OPC server. A parent area is passed in. No filtering.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
Fully qualified name of the parent area to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular source found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the sources.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComTypes._EasyAEClient.SubscribeEvents(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Subscribe to OPC events. Specify server descriptor and subscription parameters objects, and "refresh when active" flag.
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Subscription parameters to be used when the subscription is created

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the event subscription.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Engine.EasyAELinkParameters.LinkRetrialDelay
member.summary: Link retrial delay. Number of milliseconds. If a specific OPC link is found to be not operational, further attempts to use it will not be made until the link retrial delay elapses. One of typical reasons for entering the link retrial period is using an unknown OPC area or source name, which can later become correct when the OPC server configuration is updated.

remarks.para: The value must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Engine.EasyAELinkParameters.BufferSize
member.summary: Subscription buffer size. Maximum number of events that the OPC server will send in a single callback.

remarks.para: The value must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Engine.EasyAELinkParameters.FastestNotificationRate
member.summary: Fastest notification rate. Number of milliseconds. If the client application specifies notification rate faster than the value specified here, EasyOPC will use the value from this field instead.

remarks.para: The value must be greater than zero, or it must be equal to .

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Engine.EasyAELinkParameters.SlowestNotificationRate
member.summary: Slowest notification rate. Number of milliseconds. If the client application specifies notification rate slower than the value specified here, EasyOPC will use the value from this field instead.

remarks.para: The value must be greater than zero, or it must be equal to .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with given template string.
member.param: The template string.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEQualifiedNameTemplateAttribute.TemplateString
member.summary: The template string.

remarks.para: Null is allowed, because it allows to disable the template use from certain level onwards.

Following macros can be used in template strings:
$(ParentQualifiedName) The OPC qualified name of parent node.
$(BrowseName) The browse name of current node.

member.summary: Denotes that the type should be involved in OPC Alarms&Events mapping.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind
member.summary: Specifies how the OPC Alarms&Events event will be mapped.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Result
member.summary: Map the operation result, as or a derived type specific for the operation.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ErrorId
member.summary: Map the error ID, as

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Exception
member.summary: Map the exception, as or a derived type. null if the operation has been successful.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Map the error message, as . An empty string if the operation has been successful.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.StatusInfo
member.summary: Map the status information, as .

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.QualifiedSourceName
member.summary: Map the source of event notification.
member.remarks: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Time
member.summary: Map the time of the event occurrence - for conditions, time that the condition transitioned into the new state or sub-condition.

remarks.para: For example, if the event notification is for acknowledgment of a condition, this would be the time that the condition became acknowledged.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Message
member.summary: Map the event notification message describing the event. This is the default mapping kind.
member.remarks: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.EventType
member.summary: Map indication of Simple, Condition-Related, or Tracking event.

remarks.para: One of constants.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.CategoryId
member.summary: Map event category ID.

remarks.para: Standard and Vendor-specific event category codes.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Severity
member.summary: Map the event severity (1..1000).
member.remarks: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.AttributeValues
member.summary: Map a dictionary of vendor-specific event attributes.

remarks.para: Attributes are vendor-specific.
If a server cannot provide reasonable data for an attribute, the returned VARIANT should be set to VT_EMPTY.
This is a dictionary where the key is attribute ID, and the value is the actual value of that event attribute.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Value
member.summary: Map vendor-specific event attribute, specified by its ID.

remarks.para: Attributes are vendor-specific.
If a server cannot provide reasonable data for an attribute, the returned VARIANT should be set to VT_EMPTY.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ConditionName
member.summary: Map the name of the condition related to this event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.SubconditionName
member.summary: Map the name of the current sub-condition, for multi-state conditions. For a single-state condition, this contains the condition name.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Enabled
member.summary: Map new state of the condition: The condition is enabled.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Active
member.summary: Map new state of the condition: The condition is active.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Acknowledged
member.summary: Map new state of the condition: The condition is acknowledged.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Quality
member.summary: Map the quality associated with the condition, as .

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: Values are as defined for the OPC Quality Flags in the OPC Data Access Server specification.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.AcknowledgeRequired
member.summary: Map a flag indicating that the related condition requires acknowledgment of this event.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The determination of those events which require acknowledgment is server specific. For example, transition into a LimitAlarm condition would likely require an acknowledgment, while the event notification of the resulting acknowledgment would likely not require an acknowledgment.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ActiveTime
member.summary: Map time that the condition became active (for single-state conditions), or the time of the transition into the current sub-condition (for multi-state conditions).

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: This time is used by the client when acknowledging the condition.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.Cookie
member.summary: Map server defined cookie associated with the event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The cookie is used by the client when acknowledging the condition. This value is opaque to the client.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.LiveMapping.AEEventMappingKind.ActorId
member.summary: Map actor ID.

para.b: This property is used only for Tracking Events and for Condition-Related Events which are acknowledgment notifications (see EventType).

remarks.para: For tracking events, this is the actor ID for the event notification.
For condition-related events, this is the AcknowledgerID when the new state is acknowledged. If the AcknowledgerID is an empty string, the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
For other events, the value is an empty string.
The linking target value is not changed if the operation resulted in an exception.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Extensions.IEasyAEClientExtension2.AcknowledgeMultipleConditions(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.AEAcknowledgeConditionArguments[])
member.summary: Acknowledges multiple conditions in the Event Server.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
Conditions to be acknowledged.
member.returns: An array of objects, with indices corresponding to the input array.
member.remarks: The size of the input array will become the size of the output array. The element positions (indices) in the output array are the same as in the input array.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Extensions.IEasyAEClientExtension2.SubscribeMultipleEvents(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.AEEventsSubscriptionArguments[])

overloads.remarks: The size of the input array will become the size of the output array. The element positions (indices) in the output array are the same as in the input array.
overloads.returns: The function returns an array of integer handles. Each such handle uniquely identifies the events subscription. The indices of elements in the output array are the same as those in the input array.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.AEAcknowledgeConditionArguments.#ctor(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AENodeDescriptor,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64,System.String,System.String)
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

A condition name, identifying the condition that is being acknowledged. Condition Names are unique within the scope of the event server. Examples of Condition Names might be "LevelAlarm" or "Deviation".

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

A string passed in by the client, identifying who is acknowledging the condition. This is an attribute (AcknowledgerID) of the condition that identifies who acknowledged the condition. This is just a string generated by the client. This is also also included as the ActorId in the acknowledgment event notification sent to all subscribing clients. When omitted, a value is used. An AcknowledgerId cannot result in an empty string, since such AcknowledgerId is used to indicate that the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
Comment string passed in by the client associated with acknowledging the condition. An empty string indicating no comment is allowed. When omitted, an empty string is used instead.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.AEEventsSubscriptionArguments.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Object,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AESubscriptionFilter,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEAttributeSetDictionary,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.
An that determines the filtering criteria to be used for the event subscription.

Determines the attributes to be returned for each category with event notifications. A dictionary where they key is the category ID, and the value is an array of attribute IDs for that event category.
Creates activated or deactivated subscription. See ChangeEventSubscription for more information.

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.

member.summary: Holds arguments that were used to subscribe to events in an OPC-A&E server.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs.Refresh
member.summary: Denotes whether this notification was triggered by subscription refresh.

remarks.para: When Refresh is True, the value of True in RefreshComplete tells that the refresh has completed.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs.RefreshComplete
member.summary: When True, this notification denotes that the subscription refresh is complete.

remarks.para: RefreshComplete can only be True when Refresh is also True.
When RefreshComplete is True, the property contains a null reference.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs.EnabledChanged
member.summary: Indicates to the application that the Enabled state of the condition has changed.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: If the event notification is the result of a Refresh, the value of this property should be ignored.
It is server-specific whether this property will be True for a "new event". (A "new event" is any event resulting from the related condition leaving the Inactive and Acknowledged state.)

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs.ActiveChanged
member.summary: Indicates to the application that the Active state of the condition has changed.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: If the event notification is the result of a Refresh, the value of this property should be ignored.
This property will be always True for a "new event". (A "new event" is any event resulting from the related condition leaving the Inactive and Acknowledged state.)

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs.AcknowledgedChanged

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: If the event notification is the result of a Refresh, the value of this property should be ignored.
It is server-specific whether this property will be True for a "new event". (A "new event" is any event resulting from the related condition leaving the Inactive and Acknowledged state.)

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs.EventData
member.summary: Event notification information.

remarks.para: The the property contains an object for regular event notifications, and for notifications triggered by subscription refresh (except for RefreshComplete notification).

The the property contains a null reference when an error occurred (indicating connection loss; an Exception property is filled in this case), when a connection is re-gained (an Exception property contains a null reference in this case), or when the notification indicates that subscription refresh is complete (RefreshComplete property contains True in this case).

Subscription parameters to be used when the subscription is created

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.Reactive.AENotificationObservable.Create(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AESubscriptionFilter,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEAttributeSetDictionary,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new notification observable for OPC events given by the machine name, server class, and other parameters.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
Creates activated or deactivated subscription. See ChangeEventSubscription for more information.

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.
An that determines the filtering criteria to be used for the event subscription.

Determines the attributes to be returned for each category with event notifications. A dictionary where they key is the category ID, and the value is an array of attribute IDs for that event category.
member.returns: Returns an observable for notifications about given OPC events.
member.remarks: The selector will be used for OPC Alarms&Events operations.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.EasyAEClient.SharedInstance
member.summary: A default, shared instance of the client object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The default instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We do not recommend to use the default instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or th final application expects.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.EasyAEClient.AcknowledgeCondition(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AENodeDescriptor,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64)
member.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. Uses server descriptor for specifying the OPC server. Use default acknowledger ID and an empty comment.
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

A condition name, identifying the condition that is being acknowledged. Condition Names are unique within the scope of the event server. Examples of Condition Names might be "LevelAlarm" or "Deviation".

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.EasyAEClient.AcknowledgeCondition(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64)
member.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. Uses computer name and server class for specifying the OPC server. Use default acknowledger ID and an empty comment.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
Fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

A condition name, identifying the condition that is being acknowledged. Condition Names are unique within the scope of the event server. Examples of Condition Names might be "LevelAlarm" or "Deviation".

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClientExtension
member.summary: Contains extension methods to the interface.

remarks.para: NOTE: This class is intentionally *not* placed in the Extensions namespace, but rather alongside the extendee. The extension methods in this class are commonly used, and from the point of view of the developer, can be considered as part of the interface. In addition, this placement allows less namespaces references in typical projects, and better consistency with the COM interfaces (as only methods from this extension class may appear in the COM interfaces).
Other extension classes may exist as well.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClientExtension.BrowseServers(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient)

overloads.summary: Browses for OPC (Alarms&Events) servers.

member.summary: Browses the local computer and returns information about OPC (Alarms&Events) servers found.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular OPC server found on the specified machine. The keys of the keyed collection are the server's CLSIDs.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.summary: Browses the specified computer and returns information about OPC (Alarms&Events) servers found.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
Name of the machine. Determines the computer to browse for OPC servers. May be an empty string, in which case the the local computer will be browsed.
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular OPC server found on the specified machine. The keys of the keyed collection are the server's CLSIDs.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

overloads.summary: Returns the current state information for the condition instance corresponding to the source and condition name.

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.
Some servers may not maintain sufficient condition state information to fully implement this method.

member.summary: Returns the current state information for the condition instance corresponding to the source and condition name, passing in a server descriptor. No event attributes are returned.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name, as returned by browsing. The state of the condition instance associated with this source is returned.
A condition name, as returned by querying. The state of this condition is returned.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains information about the state of the condition.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClientExtension.AcknowledgeCondition(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AENodeDescriptor,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64,System.String)

overloads.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. The client will receive event notifications (indicating the acknowledgement) from conditions. This method specifically acknowledges the condition becoming active or transitioning into a different sub-condition (and no other state transition of the condition). One or more conditions belong to a specific event source - the source of the event notification. For each condition-related event notification, the corresponding Source, Condition Name, Active Time and Cookie is received by the client as part of the event notification.

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.
The client is required to pass the activeTime and cookie received in the event notification to the AcknowledgeCondition method without modification.

member.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. Uses server descriptor for specifying the OPC server. Pass in acknowledger ID, use empty comment.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

A condition name, identifying the condition that is being acknowledged. Condition Names are unique within the scope of the event server. Examples of Condition Names might be "LevelAlarm" or "Deviation".

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

A string passed in by the client, identifying who is acknowledging the condition. This is an attribute (AcknowledgerID) of the condition that identifies who acknowledged the condition. This is just a string generated by the client. This is also also included as the ActorId in the acknowledgment event notification sent to all subscribing clients. When omitted, a default value from .AcknowledgerId is used. An AcknowledgerId cannot result in an empty string, since such AcknowledgerId is used to indicate that the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClientExtension.AcknowledgeCondition(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. Uses computer name and server class for specifying the OPC server. Pass in acknowledger ID and comment.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.

Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.

Fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

A string passed in by the client, identifying who is acknowledging the condition. This is an attribute (AcknowledgerID) of the condition that identifies who acknowledged the condition. This is just a string generated by the client. This is also also included as the ActorId in the acknowledgment event notification sent to all subscribing clients. When omitted, a default value from .AcknowledgerId is used. An AcknowledgerId cannot result in an empty string, since such AcknowledgerId is used to indicate that the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
Comment string passed in by the client associated with acknowledging the condition. An empty string indicating no comment is allowed. When omitted, an empty string is used instead.

overloads.summary: The QueryEventCategories method gives clients a means of finding out the specific categories of events supported by a given server. This method would typically be invoked prior to specifying an event filter. Servers are able to define their own custom event categories, but a list of recommended categories is provided in the OPC specification.

member.summary: Finds out events categories supported by the server. Server descriptor is used for specifying the OPC server. Queries event categories for all available event types.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about an event category implemented by the server. The keys of the keyed collection are the event category IDs.

overloads.summary: Subscribe to particular OPC events. The is generated for each event.

member.summary: Subscribe to OPC events, using an object that holds all necessary arguments.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
Holds an OPC server descriptor, event subscription parameters, and possibly a callback method, as arguments to subscription operation.
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the event subscription.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClientExtension.SubscribeEvents(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AESubscriptionParameters,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Subscribe to OPC events. Specify server descriptor and subscription parameters objects, and "refresh when active" flag.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
Subscription parameters to be used when the subscription is created

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the event subscription.

member.summary: Subscribe to OPC events. Specify machine name, server class, notification rate, filter object, returned attributes, callback method, and "active" and "refresh when active" flags.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.

Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server.

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.
A callback method to be invoked for each OPC event.
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.
An that determines the filtering criteria to be used for the event subscription.

Determines the attributes to be returned for each category with event notifications. A dictionary where they key is the category ID, and the value is an array of attribute IDs for that event category.
Creates activated or deactivated subscription. See ChangeEventSubscription for more information.

When set, the subscription will automatically perform a Refresh after each successful connection to the server (either the initial connection, or any automatic reconnection after the connection is lost).
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the event subscription.
member.remarks: If is a null reference, only the events will be generated, but no callback method will be invoked.

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.
The state object (can be any value supplied by your code); available in event notifications.

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.
Some servers may not maintain sufficient condition state information to fully implement this method.

member.summary: Returns the current state information for the condition instance corresponding to the source and condition name, passing in a server descriptor. Also allows to retrieve specified event attributes.
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name, as returned by browsing. The state of the condition instance associated with this source is returned.
A condition name, as returned by querying. The state of this condition is returned.
Specifies the event attributes to be returned.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains information about the state of the condition.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient.AcknowledgeCondition(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AENodeDescriptor,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int64,System.String,System.String)

overloads.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. The client will receive event notifications (indicating the acknowledgement) from conditions. This method specifically acknowledges the condition becoming active or transitioning into a different sub-condition (and no other state transition of the condition). One or more conditions belong to a specific event source - the source of the event notification. For each condition-related event notification, the corresponding Source, Condition Name, Active Time and Cookie is received by the client as part of the event notification.

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.
The client is required to pass the activeTime and cookie received in the event notification to the AcknowledgeCondition method without modification.

member.summary: Acknowledges a condition in the Event Server. Uses server descriptor for specifying the OPC server. Pass in acknowledger ID and comment.
member.param: The OPC server involved in the operation.
Contains fully qualified source name. Identifies the source of the condition that is being acknowledged, e.g. FIC101.

A condition name, identifying the condition that is being acknowledged. Condition Names are unique within the scope of the event server. Examples of Condition Names might be "LevelAlarm" or "Deviation".

An active time corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair. This parameter uniquely identifies a specific transition of the condition to the active state or into a different sub-condition and is the same as the .SubconditionActiveTime condition attribute. Active Times are passed to the client in the event notification. If the condition has become active again or transitioned into a different sub-condition at a later time, this acknowledgment will be ignored.

A server supplied "cookie" corresponding to the Source and Condition Name pair that in addition to the Active Time uniquely identifies a specific event notification. Cookies are passed to the client in the event notification. The client is responsible for returning the same cookie parameter, received in the event notification, back to the server in the condition acknowledgment.

A string passed in by the client, identifying who is acknowledging the condition. This is an attribute (AcknowledgerID) of the condition that identifies who acknowledged the condition. This is just a string generated by the client. This is also also included as the ActorId in the acknowledgment event notification sent to all subscribing clients. When omitted, a default value from .AcknowledgerId is used. An AcknowledgerId cannot result in an empty string, since such AcknowledgerId is used to indicate that the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
Comment string passed in by the client associated with acknowledging the condition. An empty string indicating no comment is allowed. When omitted, an empty string is used instead.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient.ChangeEventSubscription(System.Int32,System.Int32,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AESubscriptionFilter,System.Boolean)

overloads.summary: Changes parameters of a particular event subscription.

member.summary: Changes parameters of an event subscription. Specify new notification rate, subscription filter object, and an "active" flag.
member.param: Event subscription handle as returned by the SubscribeEvents method

The requested notification rate. The notification rate is in milliseconds and tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this UNLESS the buffer size is reached. A value of 0 for notification rate means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter is used to improve communications efficiency between client and server. This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.
An that determines the filtering criteria to be used for the event subscription.

Activates or deactivates the subscription. If the client deactivates the subscription, then the server will no longer send event notifications to the client based on that subscription, and has no responsibility to buffer or maintain the event notifications. Thus event notifications may be lost. Even if the subscription is inactive, the Refresh method will still function. In effect, this allows a client to obtain current condition states from time to time (by invoking Refresh) without the need to process event notifications in "real time".

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.IEasyAEClient.RefreshEventSubscription(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Force a refresh for all active conditions and inactive, unacknowledged conditions whose event notifications match the filter of the event subscription.
Clients often need to get the current condition information from the server, particularly at client startup, for things such as a current alarm summary. The OPC Event Server supports this requirement by resending the most recent event notifications which satisfy the filter in the event subscription and which are related to active and/or unacknowledged conditions. The client can then derive the current condition status from the "refreshed" event notifications.
member.param: Event subscription handle as returned by the SubscribeEvents method

remarks.para: When the client needs a refreshed list of active conditions, it will request a "refresh" from the server. The server will send event notifications to that specific client indicating that they are "refresh" instead of "original" event notifications. Since the client only needs to get the current state information for conditions, only condition events will be refreshed. Remark: "Refresh" is not a general "replay" capability since the server is not required to maintain an event history. Refresh is only for updating the client's state information for active or unacknowledged conditions.

In addition to the refresh indicator, there may be other differences between original and refresh event notifications. Specifically, since some attribute information available at the time of the original event notification may be unavailable at the time of the refresh, some attributes in the refresh may be null.

Refresh and original event notifications may be interleaved. Thus, it is the responsibility of the client to check time stamps on the event notifications and put them into the correct order, to ensure correct condition status is obtained.
When sending refresh event notifications, the server indicates if there are more refresh event notifications to send (see the RefreshComplete property of EasyAENotificationEventArgs).
This method is applicable to condition-related events only. Notifications for simple events and tracking events are not returned, even if they would satisfy the filter of the event subscription.
This method is applicable both when the subscription is active and when it is inactive (see the discussion of the Active for the SubscribeEvents and ChangeEventSubscription methods).

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.BrowseBranches(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browse for child branches. Specify machine name, and server class.
member.param: Name of the machine (empty string for local computer).
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to browse.
ID of the parent branch to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular branch found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the branches.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.BrowseLeaves(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Browse for child leaves. Specify machine name, and server class.
member.param: Name of the machine (empty string for local computer).
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to browse.
ID of the parent branch to be browsed (empty string for root)
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular leaf found. The keys of the keyed collection are the names of the leaves.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.BrowseServers(System.String)
member.summary: Browses the specified computer and returns information about OPC (Data Access) servers found.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer to browse for OPC servers. May be an empty string, in which case the the local computer will be browsed.
member.returns: The method returns a keyed collection of values, each containing information about a particular OPC server found on the specified machine. The keys of the keyed collection are the server's CLSIDs.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.ChangeItemSubscription(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes parameters of a subscription. Specify handle, and requested update rate.
member.param: Item subscription handle as returned by the SubscribeItem method
The new requested update rate.

remarks.para: It is more efficient to change multiple subscriptions using method.
This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.GetPropertyValue(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value of OPC property, using individual parameters specifying the OPC server, and OPC Item ID.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to read from.
The Item ID of the OPC item involved in the operation.
The numerical value of the Property ID of the OPC property being obtained
member.returns: If successful, the function returns the actual value of the OPC property requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.ReadItem(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads a named item using individual parameters specifying its location, and using server's canonical data type.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to read from.
Contains OPC item identifier.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains the value, timestamp and quality of the OPC item requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.ReadItemValue(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads a value of named item using individual parameters specifying its location, using server's canonical data type.
member.param: Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to read from.
Contains OPC item identifier.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns the actual value of OPC item requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.ComTypes._EasyDAClient.SubscribeItem(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Subscribe to OPC item. Specify machine name, server class, item ID, and requested update rate. No state object is specified (this overload is suitable for simple scenarios only).

Contains ProgID of the OPC server.
ID of the item that will be subscribed to.
How often should the updates be received (number of milliseconds)

remarks.para: This method uses lists instead of arrays.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.ReadItem``1(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor)

overloads.summary: Reads a typed named item from an OPC server. A typed value, quality and timestamp are returned.

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.
The ReadItem method only waits for the first update from the server (or until the timeout elapses); it does not wait until the quality becomes "uncertain" or "good".

member.summary: Reads a typed named item using descriptor objects for the OPC server and OPC-DA item.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
The OPC item involved in the operation.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains the value, timestamp and quality of the OPC item requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.ReadItem``1(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DAReadParameters)
member.summary: Reads a typed named item using descriptor objects for the OPC server and OPC-DA item, and specifying read parameters such as the data source or value age.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
The OPC item involved in the operation.
Read parameters, such as the data source or value age.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains the value, timestamp and quality of the OPC item requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.ReadItem``1(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads a typed named item using individual parameters specifying its location, and a specific data type.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.

Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to read from.
Contains OPC item identifier.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains the value, timestamp and quality of the OPC item requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.ReadItem``1(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a typed named item using individual parameters specifying its location, and value age.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.

Name of the machine. Determines the computer on which the OPC server is located. May be an empty string, in which case the OPC server is assumed to exist on the local computer or at the computer specified for it by DCOM configuration.
Contains ProgID of the OPC server to read from.
Contains OPC item identifier.
The age of value you would like to obtain (in milliseconds).
member.returns: If successful, the function returns a object. The object contains the value, timestamp and quality of the OPC item requested.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

remarks.para: The data source (a device, OPC server's cache, or a value from OPC client component memory cache) is dynamically determined based on the argument.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.ReadItemValue``1(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor)

overloads.summary: Reads a typed named item from an OPC server. Only the item's typed value is returned (quality and timestamp are not returned).

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.

Use this method if you are only interested in the actual typed value of the OPC item. Use ReadItem method if you also need the quality or timestamp. The ReadItemValue method makes it very easy to obtain the actual typed data value with just one function call.
The ReadItemValue method waits until the quality becomes "good", or the timeout elapses.

member.summary: Reads a value of typed named item using descriptor objects for the OPC server and OPC-DA item.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
The OPC item involved in the operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.
member.returns: If successful, the function returns the actual, typed value of OPC item requested.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.WriteItemValue``1(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor,``0)

overloads.summary: Writes a typed value into a (typed) named item in an OPC server. Only the item's typed value is written (quality and timestamp are not written).

remarks.para: The server can be local or can be remotely accessed via DCOM. Optionally, an access path can be specified or a specific data type can be requested.

The typed value to be written.
member.exception: Thrown when the OPC operation fails.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.GetItemPropertyRecord(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor)

overloads.summary: Obtains a structure filled with OPC property values for a given OPC item.

member.summary: Obtains a structure filled with OPC property values of all well-known OPC properties for a given OPC item.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
The descriptor of the OPC node involved in the operation.
member.returns: Returns a structure containing the OPC property values requested.

remarks.p: This method allows you to obtain a structure filled in with property values for a given OPC item. It can retrieve all well-known properties at once, or you can pass in a set of property Ids that you are interested in. You can then simply use the properties in the resulting structure, without further looking up the values in any way.
Using implicit conversions, you can pass an item ID in place of node descriptor.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.GetItemPropertyRecord(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DAPropertyId},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Obtains a structure filled with OPC property values for a given OPC item. You can specify the property Ids.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
The descriptor of the OPC node involved in the operation.
Specifies which OPC properties should be obtained and returned.
If false, any failures cause the method to throw an exception. If true, failures are ignored, and the affected OPC properties will contain default values.
member.returns: Returns a structure containing the OPC property values requested.

remarks.p: This method allows you to obtain a structure filled in with property values for a given OPC item. It can retrieve all well-known properties at once, or you can pass in a set of property Ids that you are interested in. You can then simply use the properties in the resulting structure, without further looking up the values in any way.
Using implicit conversions, you can pass an item ID in place of node descriptor.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.Extensions.IEasyDAClientExtension2.GetPropertyValueDictionary(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.IEasyDAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.ServerDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.DataAccess.DANodeDescriptor)

overloads.summary: Obtains a filled with OPC property values for a given OPC item.

member.summary: Obtains a dictionary filled with all well-known OPC property values for a given OPC item.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
The OPC server involved in the operation.
The descriptor of the OPC node involved in the operation.
member.returns: Returns a dictionary of objects keyed by .

remarks.p:
This method allows you to obtain a dictionary of property values for a given OPC item, where a key to the dictionary is the property Id. You can pass in a set of property Ids that you are interested in, or have the method obtain all well-known OPC properties. You can then easily extract the value of any property by looking it up in a dictionary (as opposed to having to numerically index into an array, as with the base
method).
Using implicit conversions, you can pass an item ID in place of node descriptor.
